Constructor Detail

Transaction

public Transaction(java.lang.String firstName,
                   java.lang.String lastName,
                   java.lang.String customerID,
                   java.lang.String employeeName,
                   java.lang.String employeeID,
                   double taxPercent)
Constructs an empty transaction for the given customer name and id. I made this other constructor because I don't think you should pass the customer's Account object to the 1st Transaction constructor. If you did, then this class can do things like thisAccount.setName("newName").

Parameters:
firstName - the first name of the customer account.
lastName - the last name of the customer account.
customerID - the customer's membership card number.
employeeName - the first name of the employee that initially handled the transaction.
employeeID - the employee's id.
taxPercent - the percent the tax amount is as a double.
Precondition:
  • The customer account exists and is able to rent movies (account.getStatus() == true).
  • The transactionID should be a positive number and be the smallest id that does not yet exist in the database.
Postcondition:
  • The transaction/invoice is associated with the customer

markPaid

public boolean markPaid(pos.Payment payment,
                        int nextAvailableInvoiceID)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Marks the transaction as finalized/paid.

Parameters:
payment - the payment method and ammount.
nextAvailableInvoiceID - the invoice id that this ivoice is associated with.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Transaction has already been paid for or if the amount is not enough
Precondition:
  • The transaction has not been paid for.
  • payment.getAmount() >= thisTransaction.getSubTotal() + thisTransaction.getTax()
  • payment has been verified
    • for cash, the employee should visually inspect it.
    • for credit, the dummy credit card machine class should verify it.
    • for debit, the dummy debit machine class should verify it.
Postcondition:
  • The payment method and ammount is recorded in the transaction/invoice
  • Transaction items can not be added anymore.
  • The transaction has been marked as paid and this.isPaid() returns true.

getInvoiceID

public int getInvoiceID()
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Returns the invoice ID.

Returns:
the invoice number
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the transaction has not been paid for.
Precondition:
  • Payment for the transaction has been made. Invoice number is set when the customer has paid.

addTransactionItem

public void addTransactionItem(pos.TransactionItem item)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Adds a transaction item to the current transaction.

Parameters:
line - the transaction item to add
Precondition:
  • Payment for the transaction has not been made (thisTransaction.isPaid() == false).
Postcondition:
  • The subtotal for the transaction is updated.
  • The total tax amount is updated.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

removeTransactionItem

public boolean removeTransactionItem(int lineNumber)
                              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Removes a transaction item from the transaction.

Parameters:
lineNumber - the item you want to remove from the transaction.
Returns:
returns true if the transaction item was removed.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (lineNumber less than 0 or greater than this.getNumberOfItems())
Precondition:
  • (lineNumber is betwen 1 and this.getNumberOfItems(), inclusive)
Postcondition:
  • The transaction item associated with the lineNumber is removed. All other item's line numbers are shifted down

removeLastTransactionItem

public boolean removeLastTransactionItem()
                                  throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Removes the last transaction item added.

Returns:
returns true if the last transaction was successfuly removed.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the list is empty
Precondition:
  • The number of items in the transaction is not zero
Postcondition:
  • The last transaction item added is removed.

getDate

public java.util.Date getDate()
                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Gets the date of the transaction. The date of the transaction is set after payment is made and the transaction is finished.

Returns:
the date the transaction was completed.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the transaction has not been paid for (no payment == no transaction has happened).
